events.originalText: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 (aircraft pictured) crashed shortly after take-off from Addis Ababa, with the deaths of all 157 people on board.
events.subtitle: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302
events.headline: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302 crashes after take-off from Addis Ababa, 157 dead

events.originalText: The New York Times revealed that Governor of New York Eliot Spitzer had used a prostitution service.
events.subtitle: The New York Times
events.headline: Governor of New York Eliot Spitzer linked to prostitution service

events.originalText: NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter (artist's impression pictured) reached and entered orbit around Mars.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter enters orbit around Mars

events.originalText: Eighteen months after seizing power, Prosper Avril was ousted as the military head of state of Haiti.
events.subtitle: Prosper Avril
events.headline: Prosper Avril ousted as military head of state of Haiti

events.originalText: Astronomers using NASA's Kuiper Airborne Observatory discovered a faint ring system around Uranus.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: Faint ring system discovered around Uranus by NASA astronomers

events.originalText: Ho Chi Minh Campaign: North Vietnam began its final push for victory over South Vietnam with an attack on Ban Me Thuot.
events.subtitle: 1975 spring offensive
events.headline: North Vietnam launches final push for victory over South Vietnam

events.originalText: Vietnam War/Laotian Civil War: North Vietnamese and Pathet Lao forces overwhelmed the American, Laotian, Thai, and Hmong defenders of Lima Site 85.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: North Vietnamese forces overwhelm defenders at Lima Site 85

events.originalText: British progressive-rock band Pink Floyd released their first single, "Arnold Layne".
events.subtitle: Progressive rock
events.headline: Pink Floyd releases first single, 'Arnold Layne'

events.originalText: Military prime minister of South Vietnam Nguyễn Cao Kỳ sacked rival General Nguyễn Chánh Thi, precipitating large-scale civil and military dissension in parts of the nation.
events.subtitle: Nguyễn Cao Kỳ
events.headline: Military prime minister of South Vietnam Nguyễn Cao Kỳ sacks rival General Nguyễn Chánh Thi

events.originalText: Thomas Playford, Premier of South Australia, left office after 27 years, the longest term of any democratically elected leader in the history of Australia.
events.subtitle: Thomas Playford IV
events.headline: Premier of South Australia Thomas Playford leaves office after 27 years

events.originalText: An anti-Chinese uprising began as thousands of Tibetans surrounded the Potala Palace in Lhasa to prevent the Dalai Lama from leaving or being removed by the Chinese army.
events.subtitle: 1959 Tibetan uprising
events.headline: Anti-Chinese uprising in Tibet as thousands surround Potala Palace

events.originalText: Mildred Gillars, nicknamed Axis Sally, was convicted of treason for working with the Nazis as a broadcaster.
events.subtitle: Mildred Gillars
events.headline: Axis Sally convicted of treason for working with Nazis

events.originalText: World War II: The United States Army Air Forces conducted a firebombing raid on Tokyo that killed at least 90,000 people.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: US Army Air Forces conduct firebombing raid on Tokyo, 90,000 dead

events.originalText: The final letter in the McMahon–Hussein Correspondence was written, agreeing that Britain would recognise Arab independence in return for the Sharif of Mecca launching a revolt against the Ottoman Empire.
events.subtitle: McMahon–Hussein Correspondence
events.headline: McMahon–Hussein Correspondence final letter written, agreement reached

events.originalText: The Battle of Neuve Chapelle, the first deliberately planned British offensive of the First World War, began.
events.subtitle: Battle of Neuve Chapelle
events.headline: Battle of Neuve Chapelle: First British offensive of WWI begins

events.originalText: The Roman Republic defeated Carthaginian forces at the Battle of the Aegates, off the western coast of Sicily, in the final battle of the First Punic War.
events.subtitle: Roman Republic
events.headline: Roman Republic defeats Carthaginian forces at Battle of the Aegates
